identificationModule.briefTitle: Validation of Electrical Cardiometry Versus Fick Method in Cardiac Output Measurement
identificationModule.officialTitle: Validation of Electrical Cardiometry Versus Fick Method to Measure Stroke Volume and Cardiac Output in Patients With or Suspected of Having Heart Failure

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The investigators would like to find out if AESCULONÂ®, a new device that non-invasively and continuously measures cardiac output using electrical cardiometry, works as well as one existing method--Fick method in patients undergoing cardiopulmonary exercise testing.

primaryOutcomes.measure: difference in CO measurements with two methods
primaryOutcomes.description: the true difference between the two CO measurements is 10% of the mean CO
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: two weeks after finishing the exercise test

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Adult patients of 18 years or older who undergo cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET) with invasive hemodynamic monitoring for their routine care.
